definitions.definition: To break apart and fall down suddenly ; to cave in .
To cease to function due to a sudden breakdown ; to fail suddenly and completely.
examples: Pyramid schemes tend to generate profits for a while and then collapse .

definitions.definition: In a hierarchical list (such as a directory tree or table of contents ), to hide the subentries of (an entry ).

examples: Hurry up and collapse the tent so we can get moving.

definitions.definition: To pass out and fall to the floor or ground, as from exhaustion or other illness; to faint .
examples: The exhausted singer collapsed on stage and had to be taken to the hospital.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To break apart and fall down suddenly ; to cave in .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To cease to function due to a sudden breakdown ; to fail suddenly and completely.
( transitive , computing ) In a hierarchical list (such as a directory tree or table of contents ), to hide the subentries of (an entry ).
( intransitive , cricket ) To suffer a batting collapse .
( transitive ) To cause something to collapse.
( intransitive ) To pass out and fall to the floor or ground, as from exhaustion or other illness; to faint .
